oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: T. Graham Brown - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews T. Graham Brown (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of August 08, 1988. The episode is part 2 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; T. Graham Brown
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Pulsebeat show -- (00:43) Spangler introduces "I Tell it Like it Used to be," and T. Graham Brown reflects on the intimidation of Alex Harvey -- (02:04) Hell and High Water (T. Graham Brown) -- (04:58) Spangler introduces the break -- (05:18) Spangler and Brown reflect on Brown's transition from 'Southern beach music' to 'country soul' -- (06:06) I Tell it Like it Used to be (T. Graham Brown) -- (08:44) Ron Olson and David Page discuss the local news of the week -- (10:28) Spangler introduces the break -- (10:46) Spangler reintorduces Brown to discuss where he got the nickname "His T-Ness" -- (12:20) Darlene (T. Graham Brown) -- (15:08) Spangler reveals a moment Brown had at the Grand Ole Opry, and Brown associates it to the awesome ways children get involved with music -- (16:15) Last Resort (T. Graham Brown) -- (19:14) Spangler introduces the break -- (19:38) Spangler asks Brown what song he wished to hear -- (20:37) 1982 (Randy Travis) -- (23:22) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Brown, T. Graham;
